articles.title: Powerful earthquake strikes Afghanistan, killing over 250 people
articles.description: A powerful earthquake of magnitude 6.0 has struck Afghanistan, resulting in the deaths of at least 250 people and injuring over 400. Rescue operations are currently underway in the affected provinces, but are being hampered by poor infrastructure.

articles.title: Chicago officials threaten legal action over potential Trump deployment of National Guard
articles.description: Officials in Chicago are threatening legal action against the Trump administration following plans to expand ICE enforcement and the potential deployment of the National Guard to the city. This comes after a violent Labor Day weekend in Chicago.

articles.title: Russia accused of jamming plane carrying European Commission President
articles.description: Russia is being accused of jamming the GPS signal of an airplane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen during her official visit to Bulgaria. The incident forced the pilots to land the aircraft using paper maps.
